Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk hyperv-daemons
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: hyperv-daemons enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The hyperv-daemons packages provide a suite of daemons that are needed when a Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guest is running on Microsoft Hyper-V. The following daemons are included: hypervkvpd, the guest Hyper-V Key-Value Pair (KVP) daemon. hypervvssd, the implementation of Hyper-V VSS functionality. hypervfcopyd, the implementation of Hyper-V file copy service functionality. This update adds the following enhancements: hypervfcopyd daemon was added to hyperv-daemons package. This update provides the file copy service functionality for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guests running on Microsoft Hyper-V. The daemon enables a Microsoft Hyper-V host to copy a file using VMBUS into Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guests. Using this update, it is possible to transfer files from a Microsoft Hyper-V host to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guests. (BZ#1119188) The hypervvssd daemon has now been added to the default Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 installation process, enabling HyperV VSS functionality for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guests. The daemon is used for Microsoft Hyper-V host initiated snapshots of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guests. This update now allows users running Microsoft Hyper-V hosts to obtain snapshots of their Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 guests using traditional Microsoft Windows backup tools. (BZ#1047393) Users of hyperv-daemons are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
